customer_addr:
370 INDIAN TRAIL ROAD
FORT PLAIN, NY 13339

citations.narrative:
Several puppies which had been recently weaned did not have a form of ID. The puppies had been identified utilizing
cage card methods, however the cards did not contain the complete information required. In addition, the puppies had
been moved to a different enclosure from the dam since being weaned and the cage cards were not attached to the
enclosure containing the puppies. Puppies under 16 weeks that are identified using cage cards must have the card
attached to the outside of the enclosure. In addition, cage cards that serve as ID purposes as well as inventory purposes
must contain the required information and be attached to the outside of the enclosure where the puppies are located. The
licensee needs to correct this issue.
**********Correct by September 21, 2023

An emergency plan had not yet been documented by the licensee. A written plan must be developed which describes the
steps that will be taken in order to provide care for the animals in the event of an emergency. The plan should include any
emergency or event which would be reasonably expected to occur in the geographical area. The facility must develop and
document a contingency plan.
*********Correct by October 1, 2023

Food for the dogs is being stored in an area next to bottles of chemicals and tools. Storage of chemicals adjacent to food
items can potentially lead to contamination and affect the quality of the food. This could cause illness to the dogs. The
facility needs to correct this issue.
*********Correct by Sep. 21, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(a) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Several puppies which had been recently weaned did not have a form of ID. The puppies had been identified utilizing 
cage card methods, however the cards did not contain the complete information required. In addition, the puppies had 
been moved to a different enclosure from the dam since being weaned and the cage cards were not attached to the 
enclosure containing the puppies. Puppies under 16 weeks that are identified using cage cards must have the card 
attached to the outside of the enclosure. In addition, cage cards that serve as ID purposes as well as inventory purposes 
must contain the required information and be attached to the outside of the enclosure where the puppies are located. The 
licensee needs to correct this issue. 
**********Correct by September 21, 2023 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
An emergency plan had not yet been documented by the licensee. A written plan must be developed which describes the 
steps that will be taken in order to provide care for the animals in the event of an emergency. The plan should include any 
emergency or event which would be reasonably expected to occur in the geographical area. The facility must develop and 
document a contingency plan.  
*********Correct by October 1, 2023 
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Food for the dogs is being stored in an area next to bottles of chemicals and tools. Storage of chemicals adjacent to food 
items can potentially lead to contamination and affect the quality of the food. This could cause illness to the dogs. The 
facility needs to correct this issue.  
*********Correct by Sep. 21, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

n
